context: <b5_0>Avicenna<b5_0/> was born c. 980 in Afšana, a village near <a1_0><b11_0>Bukhara<b11_0/><a1_0/> (in present-day <a0_0><b6_0><b9_0><b10_0>Uzbekistan<b10_0/><b9_0/><b6_0/><a0_0/>), the capital of the Samanids, a Persian dynasty in Central Asia and Greater Khorasan. His mother, named <a3_0><b13_0>Setareh<b13_0/><a3_0/>, was from Bukhara; his father, Abdullah, was a respected Ismaili scholar from Balkh, an important town of the Samanid Empire, in what is today Balkh Province, <a2_0><b12_0>Afghanistan<b12_0/><a2_0/>, although this is not universally agreed upon. His father worked in the government of <b7_0>Samanid<b7_0/> in the village Kharmasain, a Sunni regional power. After five years, his younger brother, Mahmoud, was born. Avicenna first began to learn <b8_0>the Quran and literature<b8_0/> in such a way that when he was <a4_0><b14_0>ten<b14_0/><a4_0/> years old he had essentially learned all of them.
